result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Offer to Settle

Defendant Jeanine R. OClaire in court with attorney Courtney J Latzig.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties agree with the Offer to settle. 15CM67 Count 1 DRI. 15CM128 Counts 2,3 DRI. Both charges in 16CM154 are DRI.  16CF201 Counts 1,4,5 are DRI. PLEADS NC to all other counts. singed PQ, took medication as pres. Understands elements of each crime. Wants ct to accept pleas of NC. Ct accepts pleas and finds G. State complied with Vic rights. - no response. ADA comments def has prior record. Atty comments asking court to accept the recommendation, with 31 days sentence credit.  15CM67- pay a fine of 1731.45, 150 days jail 31 days credit, work release, Good time. Start jail time Immed. Bail revoked. Be to Jail by Noon today. Half price IID granted. Def will be having Surgry on foot, asking for furlough on those dates that her surgry is schd. Dec 19,  2 hrs ..Jan 5  10 hrs - and then extended on Jan 12.  ADA comments on request wants to wait and see how she does on other requests. Grant furlough on good conduct in and out of jail. Ct Grants furloguh 12/19/16  from 915am for  2 hrs. to clinc and back. Jan 5 release at 12 dirct clinc and back, 10 hrs.  Jan 12 release at 9 am return in 6 weeks Return Feb 23 at 9 am. All are based on good conduct.

Defendant Jeanine R. OClaire appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Kelly J Mcknight appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mark L Perrine in court for Defendant Jeanine R. OClaire. Cases 15CM67,128, 16CF201,16CM54. Ct believes arrangment needs to be done on 16CF201. DA's office requests moment to get Information. Ct has conversation with def re treatment, etc. Ct converses with Cpl Kulik re electronic monitoring. Def says cousin Joe Lafernier would co sign (bond) for her. Atty Perrine comments on bail. DA comments on bail, opposes motion to modify bail. Ct modifies bail, non monetary conditions are same, Ct adds provide the court with list of MH appointments and continue attending as scheduled. Bond amended to $100 cash and $1000 Signature bond with cosigner. Granted 3 hr furlough to go get her check and her cousin to cosign  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeanine R. OClaire in court by video with attorney Mark L Perrine appr in person.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 16CM54,16CF201,15CM128 and 15CM67.
Atty Perrine rec proposal from DA should have matters resolved within a month. Rec copy of compl in 16CF201, waives right to prelim. Ct finds prob cause, bound over. 
Def motion for modification of bail. Has been released on furloughs to attend counseling. Atty Perrine req SB unable to post case, SB cosigned by cousin. DA opposes request. Motion to modify bail denied.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Jeanine R. OClaire in court with attorney Mark L Perrine both by video.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  New charge, ct finds prob cause crime in Ashland County. Atty Perrine comments on missing court in other cases. 714 Dock Rd. No job, no kids, not on probation. DA comments has prior history. No driver Lic. as of now. No money to post bail. Atty comments no money to post bail. Elig for TAD will have issues since she threatened the officer.  $500.00 cash bail, absol, pres as pres, no B,T,L's, no contact with Jeanan Olbekson  and John williams unless professional contact. no driving unless valid driver lic and insurance . May grant furlough for Doc. Apt if  valid information filed.
